data.title: Best Breakfast
data.text: quick seating, very friendly staff, great food, good price. Nice out of the way meeting and dining place amidst renovated old town Salinas.  Great portions and several selections.  Metered parking on the street which was fine for us but in a crunch I see there is garage parking nearby.

data.title: Better than MRY one
data.text: I prefer this location to the one in Pacific Grove/Monterey area for breakfast/brunch! Better restaurant layout and design and food was tastier. If I returned it would be to this location. Parking can be tricky but isn't too much of a hassle.

data.title: Weird Hot Salads
data.text: My husband and I ate here twice in 4 days, first on our trip south and then again on our way back.  We'd been here several years ago and enjoyed it, but this time I didn't like it at all.  My husband had two breakfast-type lunches and he enjoyed his meals, but I ordered salads both times and they were not good.  The first time I had an oriental chicken salad, which I've had many, many times at many different places and always liked.  But this one was very weird -- the chicken was sautéed, which I knew, but then it was  dumped onto the greens and other vegetables, making it a hot dish instead of a salad.  The  vegetables were lettuce and water chestnuts and it was topped with chow mein noodles from a can, and the whole thing was swimming in a huge amount of watery dressing.  The next time I ordered a Mexican salad with black beans -- and again the whole thing was hot!  The beans were hot and then dumped on the vegetables making this a hot meal again.  It was not particularly tasty and I couldn't eat very much.  So disappointed in this place, and won't eat here again.

data.title: YUMMY!
data.text: Whenever I come to town, I like this place for breakfast. I love the food and the service has ALWAYS been good to great. I wish we had one back home just like it. I guess that makes the visit all the more special.

data.title: Be prepared to wait
data.text: There is always a wait to be seated, but well worth it.  They do offer coffee while you wait, and the atmosphere is nice as it is outside in front of the restaurant you wait. Once seated, the menu has a good choice of breakfast or lunch items.  Food is fresh and hot when served.  Food here is great! Service is outstanding.

data.title: Brunch stop en route south
data.text: We decided to stop here halfway between San Francisco and Paso Robles. We are (late in the day) breakfast people and the menu looked like it would suite us. There are so many breakfast options it was hard to choose. (There are also lots of salads and sandwiches for those who prefer lunch.) I had a veggie skillet with eggs over easy. The eggs were cooked perfectly. The veggies included broccoli, mushrooms, and squash. The portion was enormous (2 meals for me). My partner enjoyed the eggs Benedict. Service was friendly and helpful.

data.title: Best breakfast around!
data.text: I have been eating here for years and they serve the only omelets I like. Plenty of food and choices. Whenever I want breakfast, this is always my first choice. PG location is equally good.

data.title: Great food in historic old town of Salinas
data.text: Don't hesitate to try First Awakenings. While best known for Breakfast you can also get a good lunch there as well. They do close at 2 so be mindful of that.  Nice variety of dishes especially the Breakfast choices and the servers are good. In a nice location close to the theater and many shops. Would  have given it a 5 rating if they were open until 3 since my friends and I enjoy lingering over Lunch. However they are friendly and don't rush you out the door.

data.title: Okay
data.text: The food was good enough, but nothing special. I was disappointed after the strong online reviews. The service was good.

data.title: Best Breakfast in Town
data.text: This is my favorite breakfast place in town.  When ever I have a guest out of town or co-workers want to eat breakfast after work, we come here.  I almost always have their breakfast special.

data.title: Still great after all these years!
data.text: Have eaten at First Awakenings for almost 20 years and it is still as good as the first time.  You can't say that about too many restaurants these days!

data.title: Great lunch spot
data.text: Had lunch here on our way to Big Sur. Friendly service. Very reasonably priced. Sandwiches were excellent. They were served with a marinated salad of small-diced celery, cucumber, zucchini, and tomato which was delicious and potatoes, either hash brown or diced. Breakfast menu looked good too.

data.title: Awesome Service, Amazing Breakfast!
data.text: I LOVE the Wheatberry Pancakes here, so delicious.. I get these everytime I visit First Awakenings. The service is always friendly and welcoming as well. There is a very cool, and calming atmosphere here, which is refreshing. The prices are a little much, but the food makes up for it.

data.title: Great salads!
data.text:
My husband and I visited Salinas whilst on vacation in Monterey. We found First Awakenings for lunch and were very impressed. I had the best salad ever! It was fruity chicken salad with six different types of fresh fruit and chicken mayo with raisins and water chestnuts. What a combo! Fantastic. My husband was equally impressed with his chicken and spicy noodles. Staff very friendly too.

.

data.title: Great food but a bit on the expensive side.
data.text: Everything on the menu is good.  We have had both breakfast and lunch and really like the breakfast.  Good portions and good service.

data.title: Great breakfast stop!
data.text: Good food, good service! Our favorite breakfast stop. Friends have said lunches are also great. Friendly, knowledgable servers there. Voted best breakfast in Monterey County!

data.title: Fresh and delicious food, great service, every time we go
data.text: We went to lunch at First Awakenings, and we ordered lunch.  It is hard to not to get breakfast entrees because they are always so good.  We ordered the Chicken Quesadilla and the Cobb Salad.  Both were fantastic.  I ordered the Cobb Salad "untossed".  The Chicken Quesadilla came with potatoes and fresh fruit.  Everything was delicious.  The portions are generous.  TIP:  If you ask, they will bring you a plate and let you split your entree, or they more "split" the plate for you.

data.title: BEST BREAKFAST ANYWHERE!!
data.text: I come to Salinas to visit family regularly and always plan my return flight so that I can have breakfast at First Awakenings.  The menu has something for everyone and everything is delicious.  I tried many items but always come back to the eggs benedict.  Love that you can order a single!!  Blueberry pancakes are wonderful also.  Don't miss this great place.  Only negative is I wish they were open for dinner....I would be there then too.

data.title: A 'MUST GO TO' FOR BREAKFAST.
data.text: We heard of this fantastic place for breakfast as we were traveling the Pacific Coast area and had to try it out since we were staying at a motel in Salinas anyway.  WOW!!  Yes, this IS a destination for breakfast.  We were greeted very warmly at the door as we walked in.  Our waitress, Anita, was so very friendly and welcoming.  She took very good care of us.  The food was prepared and served very quickly.  It was very, very good and at a very reasonable price.  This restaurant is located in "Old Downtown Salinas".  There are many very interesting stores and shops all through this area of 'Old Downtown'.  Yes, a definite 'must go to' breakfast restaurant.

data.title: Breakfast mtg
data.text: We had a very pleasant breakfast meeting and all of the entrees were excellent and the service was very good...
